block.p: Free Caffeine Downtown
To inaugurate its new breakfast service, Morandi, 211 Waverly Place (Seventh Avenue South), will offer free coffee, including espresso drinks and teas, in the morning through June 13.
Fresh From Sicily

Anna Tasca Lanza, the cookbook author and cooking teacher from Sicily, will talk about her food, while chefs at Agata & Valentina Ristorante will prepare a four-course dinner from her recipes, starting at 7:30 p.m. Friday at the restaurant, 1513 First Avenue (79th Street); $50 not including beverages, $80 with wines, both plus tax and tip: (212) 452-0691.
Free Sake Uptown
Pour, 321 Amsterdam Avenue (75th Street), will hold a free sake tasting on Saturday from 4 to 7 p.m.
Cooking Mediterranean
A Mediterranean cooking class will be held on Saturday from 3:15 to 5:30 p.m. at Fig & Olive, 420 West 13th Street, $60: (212) 924-1200.
Reading and Banana Splits

There will be a reading by authors of essays and fiction in the summer issue of the food journal Alimentum on June 13 from 7 to 8:30 p.m. at Housing Works Bookstore and Café, 126 Crosby Street (Prince Street). Banana splits will be served: (212) 334-3324.
Benefits

The Big Apple Barbecue, sponsored by the Union Square Hospitality Group to benefit the Madison Square Park Conservancy, will be held this year on Saturday and Sunday from noon to 6 p.m. on Madison Avenue from 23rd to 26th Street; East 24th Street from Madison to Park Avenues; and East 26th Street from Madison Avenue to Broadway. More than a dozen pitmasters from New York and around the country will be serving their specialties, and there will also be seminars, cooking demonstrations and merchandise for sale. Holders of a fast pass ($100) can cut the lines. Information: bigapplebbq.org.

Scholarship programs at the French Culinary Institute will benefit from an auction on Monday from 7 to 11 p.m. at Cipriani 23rd Street, 200 Fifth Avenue, of evenings, including dinners and cooking classes, with chefs, among them Jean-Georges Vongerichten, David Chang, Wylie Dufresne and André Soltner. For tickets, $250: (646) 254-7521 or friends@frenchculinary.com.

The annual black tie Champagne dinner to benefit the American Institute of Wine and Food will be held on Tuesday at 6 p.m. at the Pierre Hotel, with Jean-François Bruel of Daniel, Matthew Hoyle of Nobu 57, Floyd Cardoz of Tabla and Nicole Kaplan of Del Posto preparing food to accompany an array of Taittinger Champagnes and a red wine from Sardinia. For tickets, $300 for members, $350 for nonmembers: (866) 468-7619, ticketweb.com.

A benefit with music, light food and dancing to raise money for the New York Coalition for Healthy School Food, which works with public schools, will be held from 7:30 to 10 p.m. on June 14 at Mannahatta, 316 Bowery (Bleecker Street). Tickets start at $75 from healthylunches.org.
